VEGAN.name: Baingan Bharta

steps.instruction: Roast eggplants until charred; peel and mash.
Sauté cumin and onions, add chili and ginger.
Add tomatoes and spices; cook down and fold in eggplant.

chefTips: Oil the eggplant before roasting for easier peeling.
Finish with a splash of mustard oil for aroma.
VEGAN.whyItWorks: Smoky eggplant with warm spices delivers depth without dairy.
VEGAN.heroSummary: A smoky vegan main that replaces creamy gravies with charred richness.

VEGAN.name: Chana Masala

steps.instruction: Sauté spices, add tomato puree and cook.
Add chickpeas and simmer until flavors meld.
Finish with chaat masala and cilantro.

chefTips: Use aquafaba (canned chickpea liquid) to adjust gravy consistency.
A pinch of baking soda while boiling makes chickpeas tender faster.
VEGAN.whyItWorks: Hearty legumes with bold spices are filling and protein-rich.
VEGAN.heroSummary: Tangy, spiced chickpeas — a vegan everyday favorite.

VEGAN.name: Aloo Gobi

steps.instruction: Sauté cumin and potatoes until slightly golden.
Add cauliflower and tomatoes; add spices and cover.
Cook until tender; finish with cilantro.

chefTips: Par-cook potatoes briefly to reduce total time.
Add a squeeze of lemon to brighten flavors.
VEGAN.whyItWorks: Starchy potatoes and cauliflower soak up spices for a comforting dish.
VEGAN.heroSummary: Classic North-Indian veg main — simple, filling, and budget-friendly.

VEGAN.name: Vegetable Biryani

steps.instruction: Par-cook rice with whole spices; drain.
Layer rice and vegetables; steam (dum) until done.
Rest 5 minutes and fluff before serving.

chefTips: Use fragrant basmati and sealed pot for better dum.
Fry some onions until caramelized for extra depth (vegan).
VEGAN.whyItWorks: Layering and slow-steaming infuses rice with vegetable aroma and spices.
VEGAN.heroSummary: Aromatic one-pot vegan biryani that stands in for meat versions.

VEGAN.name: Rajma Masala

steps.instruction: Cook kidney beans until soft.
Prepare masala with tomato and spices; add beans.

chefTips: Pressure-cook beans with a bay leaf for better aroma.
Let it sit overnight for flavors to develop further.
VEGAN.whyItWorks: Creamy beans and spice mix give a filling, protein-heavy vegan option.
VEGAN.heroSummary: Comforting red-bean curry perfect with rice or rotis.

VEGAN.name: Masoor Dal Tadka

steps.instruction: Boil dal with turmeric until soft.
Prepare tadka (tempering) and pour over dal.
Simmer 5 minutes and serve.

chefTips: Use a generous tadka for aroma — fry spices until fragrant.
Add a squeeze of lime when serving to lift flavors.
VEGAN.whyItWorks: Simple, quick protein source with aromatic tempered spices.
VEGAN.heroSummary: Quick, homely dal that pairs with rice or rotis.

VEGAN.name: Bhindi Masala

steps.instruction: Dry-fry okra until slightly crisp; set aside.
Cook tomato and spices; fold in okra and finish with amchur.

chefTips: Dry-fry okra to avoid sliminess.
Add amchur for pleasant tang without extra tomatoes.
VEGAN.whyItWorks: Texture contrast and tang keep this simple veg dish satisfying.
VEGAN.heroSummary: Crisp okra in a spiced tomato gravy — light and tasty.

VEGAN.name: Tofu Tikka

steps.instruction: Marinate tofu in spiced soya yogurt for 10–15 mins.
Grill or pan-sear until charred.

chefTips: Press tofu 20 minutes before marination to remove excess water.
Brush with oil while grilling for better color.
VEGAN.whyItWorks: Tofu absorbs spices well and gives a chewy, satisfying bite.
VEGAN.heroSummary: Plant-based tikka that grills up smoky and satisfying.

VEGAN.name: Kachumber Salad

steps.instruction: Chop all vegetables and toss with lemon, salt and cilantro.

chefTips: Chill ingredients for a crisp, refreshing side.
Add chaat masala for a street-food twist.
VEGAN.whyItWorks: Fresh vegetables and citrus cut through heavier mains.
VEGAN.heroSummary: Simple, refreshing salad — quick to assemble.

VEGAN.name: Sprouted Mung Salad

steps.instruction: Combine all ingredients and toss with lemon and salt.

chefTips: Use fresh sprouts for crunch and maximum nutrition.
Add roasted cumin powder for extra flavor.
VEGAN.whyItWorks: High-protein sprouts plus vegetables create a light, filling starter.
VEGAN.heroSummary: Protein-packed salad — fast, healthy, and vegan.

VEGAN.name: Coconut Sambar

steps.instruction: Cook dal until soft; set aside.
Cook vegetables with tamarind and sambar powder.
Combine dal, vegetables and coconut; simmer briefly.

chefTips: Grind coconut with a little water for a smooth finish.
Temper with mustard and curry leaves for classic aroma.
VEGAN.whyItWorks: Lentils + coconut balance tangy tamarind for a comforting bowl.
VEGAN.heroSummary: South-Indian lentil stew with coconut — wholesome and vegan.

VEGAN.name: Vegetable Pulao

steps.instruction: Sauté spices and vegetables; add rice and water.
Simmer until rice is cooked and fluffy.

chefTips: Use 1:1.5 rice-to-water ratio for fluffy grains.
Addition of fried cashews increases richness for parties.
VEGAN.whyItWorks: Lightly spiced rice with vegetables is a quick, complete meal.

VEGAN.name: Sprouted Lentil Dhokla

steps.instruction: Blend sprouted moong into a smooth batter; rest.
Add eno, steam batter until set; temper and serve.

chefTips: Make sure batter is airy before steaming for spongy dhokla.
Serve with green chutney and sweet chutney for contrast.
VEGAN.whyItWorks: Steamed, protein-rich snack that’s lighter than fried alternatives.
VEGAN.heroSummary: Healthy steamed dhokla made from sprouted lentils — vegan and tasty.

VEGAN.name: Coriander Peanut Chutney

steps.instruction: Blend all ingredients to a smooth chutney.

chefTips: Use roasted peanuts for deeper flavor.
Add a splash of water gradually to reach desired consistency.
VEGAN.whyItWorks: Crunchy peanuts + herbaceous coriander make a versatile dip.
VEGAN.heroSummary: Quick nutty chutney perfect for snacks and mains.

VEGAN.name: Methi Tofu Curry

steps.instruction: Sauté methi and tofu briefly; set aside.
Cook tomato-based gravy and return tofu+methi to simmer.

chefTips: Blanch methi to reduce bitterness if using mature leaves.
Press tofu before use to improve texture.
VEGAN.whyItWorks: Methi’s unique bitterness balances creamy tofu for a complex vegetal curry.
VEGAN.heroSummary: Earthy methi paired with tofu for a nutritious vegan main.

VEGAN.name: Chow Chow Poriyal

steps.instruction: Tempering with mustard and curry leaves.
Cook chow chow until tender; finish with coconut.

chefTips: Do not overcook to retain slight crunch.
Fresh coconut adds authenticity to the dish.
VEGAN.whyItWorks: Delicate vegetable keeps the plate light and complements heavier mains.
VEGAN.heroSummary: South-Indian stir-fried chayote with coconut — simple and clean.

VEGAN.name: Mixed Vegetable Korma

steps.instruction: Lightly cook vegetables to just tender.
Add cashew paste and coconut milk; simmer gently.

chefTips: Soak cashews well for a smoother paste.
Do not boil vigorously after adding coconut milk to prevent splitting.
VEGAN.whyItWorks: Nutty cashew and coconut mimic creamy textures without dairy.
VEGAN.heroSummary: Rich, dairy-free korma that pairs well with rotis and rice.

VEG.name: Paneer Butter Masala

steps.instruction: Sauté tomato puree and spices until oil separates.
Add paneer and cream; simmer briefly.

chefTips: Use high-fat cream for authentic richness.
Lightly pan-fry paneer cubes to prevent them from becoming soggy.
VEG.whyItWorks: Cream and butter give indulgent mouthfeel similar to meat gravies.
VEG.heroSummary: Classic Punjabi paneer curry — rich, creamy, and indulgent.

VEG.name: Palak Paneer

steps.instruction: Blanch and puree spinach.
Cook spinach with spices; add paneer and cream.

chefTips: Add a pinch of nutmeg for extra warmth.
Sear paneer lightly for a firmer texture.
VEG.whyItWorks: Spinach adds nutrients and bright color while paneer supplies richness.
VEG.heroSummary: Creamy spinach curry with soft paneer cubes — a staple favorite.

VEG.name: Malai Kofta

steps.instruction: Make kofta balls with paneer and potato; shallow fry.
Prepare creamy gravy and add koftas just before serving.

chefTips: Bake koftas for a lighter version.
Add raisins or nuts to kofta for a festive touch.
VEG.whyItWorks: Soft koftas in a rich gravy give a luxurious vegetarian main.
VEG.heroSummary: Indulgent paneer-potato koftas in a velvety gravy — party-ready.

VEG.name: Dhokla

steps.instruction: Make batter and rest; add eno before steaming.
Steam and temper with mustard seeds.

chefTips: Ensure batter is airy for spongy texture.
Serve with green chutney and sweet tamarind chutney.
VEG.whyItWorks: Steamed snack that’s light yet satisfying.
VEG.heroSummary: Classic Gujarati steamed cake — soft, tangy and popular as snack.

VEG.name: Samosa

steps.instruction: Prepare stuffing and shape samosas.
Deep fry until golden brown.

chefTips: Use hot oil for crispier samosas.
Serve immediately for best crunch.
VEG.whyItWorks: Crisp pastry and spicy potato filling are universally loved.
VEG.heroSummary: Crispy fried pastry filled with spiced potato and peas.

VEG.name: Masala Dosa

steps.instruction: Prepare spiced potato filling.
Spread dosa and fill with potato mixture; fold.

chefTips: Ensure fermented batter for crispness.
Smear ghee on dosa for authentic flavor.
VEG.whyItWorks: Crisp crepe with spiced potato filling is balanced and filling.
VEG.heroSummary: South-Indian staple: a crispy crepe filled with savory potato masala.

VEG.name: Pav Bhaji

steps.instruction: Mash cooked vegetables with spices and butter.
Toast pav on butter and serve with bhaji.

chefTips: Achieve a slightly coarse texture for authentic bhaji.
Garnish with chopped onions and lemon for brightness.
VEG.whyItWorks: Rich butter and spices make a humble vegetable mash indulgent.
VEG.heroSummary: Maharashtrian street classic — buttery vegetable mash with toasted buns.

VEG.name: Aloo Paratha

steps.instruction: Make stuffing and roll parathas.
Cook on tava with ghee until golden.

chefTips: Keep the dough soft for flaky parathas.
Serve hot with yogurt or pickle.
VEG.whyItWorks: Crispy outside and soft potato inside — hearty breakfast or brunch.
VEG.heroSummary: Stuffed Indian flatbread with spiced potato — fulfilling and classic.

VEG.name: Matar Paneer

steps.instruction: Cook peas and gravy until tender.
Add paneer and simmer for 5 minutes.

chefTips: Lightly fry paneer for a firmer texture.
Frozen peas work fine in a pinch.
VEG.whyItWorks: Sweet peas and paneer create a balanced, familiar curry.
VEG.heroSummary: Comforting paneer and peas curry — a family favorite.

VEG.name: Gajar Halwa

steps.instruction: Cook grated carrots in ghee; add milk and simmer.
Add sugar and cardamom; cook until mixture thickens.

chefTips: Use fresh, sweet carrots for better color and taste.
Finish with chopped nuts for texture.
VEG.whyItWorks: Slow cooking concentrates carrot sweetness into a rich dessert.
VEG.heroSummary: Slow-cooked carrot pudding scented with cardamom and nuts.

VEG.name: Besan Ladoo

steps.instruction: Roast besan in ghee until aromatic and golden.
Mix sugar and shape into laddoos when warm.

chefTips: Low heat and patience prevent burning besan.
Shape laddoos while warm for easier forming.
VEG.whyItWorks: Roasted gram flour and ghee create deep flavors and melt-in-mouth texture.
VEG.heroSummary: Classic Indian sweet — nutty and satisfying.

VEG.name: Chole Bhature

steps.instruction: Cook spiced chickpeas until thickened.
Roll and deep-fry bhature until puffed and golden.

chefTips: Ensure dough is well-rested for puffier bhature.
Serve immediately for best texture.
VEG.whyItWorks: Combination of spicy chickpea curry with fluffy fried bread is indulgent and filling.
VEG.heroSummary: Hearty Punjabi combo — spicy chole served with fluffy deep-fried bhature.

VEG.name: Veg Korma

steps.instruction: Cook vegetables and add cashew-yogurt gravy.
Simmer briefly and finish with ghee.

chefTips: Temper the gravy gently to avoid curdling yogurt.
Add fried onions for extra sweetness.
VEG.whyItWorks: Nuts and dairy give creamy mouthfeel typical of royal kormas.
VEG.heroSummary: Rich, mildly spiced korma perfect for special meals.

VEG.name: Rajgira Kheer

steps.instruction: Roast rajgira lightly and cook with milk.
Add sugar and cardamom; simmer to desired thickness.

chefTips: Stir frequently to prevent sticking.
Add a few chopped nuts for texture.
VEG.whyItWorks: Ancient grain gives a nutty twist to a classic milk pudding.
VEG.heroSummary: Comforting, slightly nutty kheer using amaranth grains.

VEG.name: Paneer Tikka

steps.instruction: Marinate paneer and vegetables in spiced yogurt.
Grill or bake until charred at edges.

chefTips: Use skewers and high heat for best char.
Brush with butter/ghee for extra sheen.
VEG.whyItWorks: Paneer soaks spices and grills to a satisfying texture similar to meat kebabs.
VEG.heroSummary: Charred, spiced paneer cubes — a party favourite.

VEG.name: Veg Biryani (Rich)

steps.instruction: Par-cook rice and prepare vegetable layer.
Layer with saffron milk and ghee; dum until fragrant.

chefTips: Use hot ghee and sealed pot for a true dum effect.
Caramelized onions add sweet umami notes.
VEG.whyItWorks: Ghee and saffron create an indulgent profile that mimics richer meat biryanis.
VEG.heroSummary: Decadent vegetable biryani with saffron and ghee — perfect for celebrations.

JAIN.name: Jain Dal Tadka

steps.instruction: Cook dal with turmeric until soft.
Temper with ghee, mustard and cumin; add tomato and simmer.

chefTips: Avoid using onion/garlic; tomatoes and hing (asafoetida) can aid savoriness.
Use fresh ghee for authentic aroma.
JAIN.whyItWorks: Simple ladle of lentils with tempering gives deep flavor without root vegetables.
JAIN.heroSummary: Pure Jain dal made flavorful through tempering and tomatoes.

JAIN.name: Jain Pulao

steps.instruction: Sauté whole spices in ghee; add raw banana and peas.
Add rice and water; cook until fluffy.

chefTips: Raw banana is a common Jain potato alternative in many regions.
Use a little rose water for celebratory pulao aroma (optional).
JAIN.whyItWorks: Substituting non-root vegetables retains texture while respecting Jain rules.
JAIN.heroSummary: Fragrant Jain-friendly pulao using raw banana instead of potato.

JAIN.name: Jain Paneer Tikka

steps.instruction: Marinate paneer in yogurt and spices without onion/garlic.
Grill until charred and serve with mint chutney.

chefTips: Label marinades as onion/garlic-free to avoid cross-contamination.
Use hung curd for thicker coating.
JAIN.whyItWorks: Maintains the grilled, spiced experience while observing Jain restrictions.
JAIN.heroSummary: Charred, spiced paneer made Jain-friendly by excluding root aromatics.

JAIN.name: Jain Pav Bhaji

steps.instruction: Cook vegetables and mash with butter and spices.
Toast pav and serve hot.

chefTips: Use raw banana or yam as potato substitutes in Jain cuisine.
Avoid onion/garlic in bhaji; rely on tomatoes, ginger and spices for depth.
JAIN.whyItWorks: Substitutes maintain texture while honoring Jain dietary rules.
JAIN.heroSummary: A Jain twist on Mumbai’s beloved street dish using potato alternatives.

JAIN.name: Jain Dhokla

steps.instruction: Prepare batter without onion/garlic and steam.
Temper with hing and mustard; serve with chutney.

chefTips: Use hing to impart umami that replaces onion/garlic flavors.
Ensure batter is adequately aerated for softness.
JAIN.whyItWorks: Fermentation and hing deliver savory notes while respecting Jain rules.
JAIN.heroSummary: Jain-safe steamed snack — soft, tangy and crowd-pleasing.

JAIN.name: Jain Chole

steps.instruction: Make tomato-based gravy without onions/garlic.
Add chickpeas and simmer; finish with amchur.

chefTips: Use asafoetida for depth in absence of onion/garlic.
Soak chickpeas overnight for best texture.
JAIN.whyItWorks: Tomatoes and spice blends provide robust flavor while meeting Jain constraints.
JAIN.heroSummary: Protein-packed chole adapted for Jain dietary rules.

JAIN.name: Jain Laal Saag

steps.instruction: Cook saag with tomato and mild spices in ghee.

chefTips: Cook quickly to retain color and nutrients.
Serve with bajra roti for a traditional meal.
JAIN.whyItWorks: Saag retains vegetal character without relying on root aromatics.
JAIN.heroSummary: Simple, nutritious leafy saag adapted for Jain diets.

JAIN.name: Jain Lauki Kofta

steps.instruction: Make kofta balls with lauki and besan; fry or bake.
Prepare yogurt-based gravy and add koftas before serving.

chefTips: Squeeze excess water from lauki to avoid soggy koftas.
Bake koftas for a lower-oil option.
JAIN.whyItWorks: Light vegetable koftas in a creamy gravy make an elegant Jain main.
JAIN.heroSummary: Delicate lauki koftas served in a mild, Jain-friendly gravy.

JAIN.name: Methi Thepla (Jain)

steps.instruction: Make dough with methi and rest.
Roll thin and cook on tava with ghee.

chefTips: Keep dough moist but firm to get pliable theplas.
Pack a few for travel — they keep well.
JAIN.whyItWorks: Fenugreek gives characteristic flavor without using root aromatics.
JAIN.heroSummary: Savory, herby flatbread suitable for Jain diets and travel-friendly.

JAIN.name: Jain Khandvi

steps.instruction: Cook besan-yogurt batter until thick; spread thin and roll.
Temper with mustard and serve.

chefTips: Work quickly when spreading batter for uniform thin sheets.
Cool slightly before slicing and rolling for neat khandvi.
JAIN.whyItWorks: Silky rolls that are light yet flavorful — onion/garlic-free.
JAIN.heroSummary: Delicate Gujarati roll snack adapted for Jain preferences.

JAIN.name: Jain Methi Muthia

steps.instruction: Mix dough and steam or pan-fry shaped muthias.
Temper with mustard seeds and sesame.

chefTips: Squeeze excess water from methi to keep dough manageable.
Pan-fry steamed muthias for a crisp exterior.
JAIN.whyItWorks: Herby steamed dumplings make a portable Jain snack.
JAIN.heroSummary: Fenugreek dumplings — nutritious, herby, and Jain-safe.

JAIN.name: Jain Moong Cheela

steps.instruction: Make a smooth batter and spread thin on tava.
Cook both sides until golden and serve with chutney.

chefTips: Use a non-stick tava for even cooking.
Add finely chopped coriander for freshness (non-root).
JAIN.whyItWorks: High-protein crepe that’s quick to prepare and Jain-compliant.
JAIN.heroSummary: Protein-rich moong crepe — simple Jain-friendly breakfast.

JAIN.name: Jain Kadhi

steps.instruction: Whisk yogurt and besan; cook on low heat until thick.
Temper with hing and ghee; simmer briefly.

chefTips: Stir continuously to avoid lumps.
Use fresh yogurt for a smooth kadhi.
JAIN.whyItWorks: Tang from yogurt and umami from hing deliver depth without root veggies.
JAIN.heroSummary: Creamy, tangy kadhi adapted for Jain palates.

JAIN.name: Bajra Roti with Ghee (Jain)

steps.instruction: Knead dough with hot water and shape rotis.
Cook on tava and smear with ghee.

chefTips: Serve with laal saag or kadhi for a complete Jain meal.
Keep dough covered to prevent drying.
JAIN.whyItWorks: Millet rotis pair well with Jain gravies for hearty, gluten-free-ish meals.
JAIN.heroSummary: Traditional bajra roti served hot with ghee — rustic and satiating.

JAIN.name: Jain Shrikhand

steps.instruction: Beat hung curd with sugar and cardamom until smooth.

chefTips: Chill well before serving for best texture.
Use saffron soaked in milk for luxurious aroma (optional).
JAIN.whyItWorks: Creamy, slightly tangy dessert that’s light and celebratory without root ingredients.
JAIN.heroSummary: Silky strained-yogurt dessert flavored with cardamom and saffron.

JAIN.name: Jain Poha

steps.instruction: Rinse poha and sauté with raw banana in tempered spices.

chefTips: Use slightly thicker poha for better texture.
Add sev or peanuts for crunch.
JAIN.whyItWorks: Light, quick breakfast that avoids onions using raw banana for texture.
JAIN.heroSummary: Comforting Jain-style poha — bright and travel-friendly.

JAIN.name: Jain Punjabi Kadhi (No Onion/Garlic)

steps.instruction: Make smooth yogurt-besan mixture and cook on low until thick.
Temper with ghee and mild spices; serve hot.

chefTips: Pakoras can be made from lauki or bottle gourd instead of potato.
Use fresh curd to avoid sourness.
JAIN.whyItWorks: Tangy yogurt base and careful tempering make a robust Jain kadhi.
JAIN.heroSummary: Comforting Punjabi kadhi adapted to Jain rules — with vegetable pakoras.

JAIN.name: Jain Khichdi

steps.instruction: Cook rice and dal together with turmeric and ghee until soft.

chefTips: Adjust water for a creamy or drier khichdi as preferred.
Serve with ghee and pickles (ensure Jain-safe pickles).
JAIN.whyItWorks: Simple, easy-to-digest meal perfect for everyday Jain consumption.
JAIN.heroSummary: Comforting rice-and-dal porridge prepared without root vegetables.
